title: About
text:
Who am I?
I work as researcher at the University of Zürich. I have dedicated the last four years to studying and improving animal welfare, promoting the best practice of reproducibility and rigour of research. Check out my experience here.
In my years of experience as a researcher, I have learned the value of data visualization in conveying messages and effectively attracting attention to disseminate my work, both within the scientific community and the general public, as well as for fun!
I have worked in the past years as freelancer in data analysis and visualization, teaching R and statistics as well as project management. Check out my portfolio here.

title: CV
text:
Augenklinik, Universitätsspital Zürich

Statistical analysis of real-world clinical data
Project coordination and quality management




Center for Reproducible Science, Ineichen Group, University of Zürich

Text mining automation in the field of animal science welfare
Data analysis, visualization and statistical modelling





Assisted users with cleaning and analysis of clinical research data
Performed modeling of data to identify correlation factors between drivers on which client needed insight
Created data visualizations to effectively convey complex research data to the broader audience





Graphical Statistics
Introduction to R, data analysis and visualization
How to write an efficient statistical plan for your grant




Swiss Reproducibility Network Academy

Promoting good research practices amongst early career researchers
Events and workshops organization

title: CV
text:
My education

PhD candidate in Biomedical Science (12.18-6.22)
Veterinary Public Health Division, University of Bern

Led research efforts and identified gaps in current scientific best practices in data analysis through Systematic Reviews and Meta Analyses
Applied advanced statistical analysis of Big Data and Mixed Effect Models in both theoretical and experimental settings
Assessed study quality and performed data simulations from publications



Master of Science (2.16-9.18)
University of Bern, Switzerland
• Ecology and Evolution with specialization in Behaviour: insigni cum laude


Bachelor of Science (10.11-9.15)
Università degli Studi di Torino, Italy
• Biology with specialization in Ecology: graded 93/110

title: Publications
